explains: adj. 应获奖的；优等的；备受赞誉的

sentences.en: The award-winning novelist often has three or four books on the go at once.
sentences.cn: 那位获奖小说家经常是三四部小说同时写的。

sentences.en: Reading award-winning literature may boost your ability to read other people, a new study suggests.
sentences.cn: 一项新的研究表明，阅读获奖文学作品可以提高你了解他人的能力。

sentences.en: Located on the shore of Sullivan's Island off the coast of South Carolina, the award-winning-cube-shaped beach house was built to replace one smashed to pieces by Hurricane Hugo 10 years ago.
sentences.cn: 这座获奖的立方体海滩别墅位于南卡罗来纳海岸外的苏利文岛的岸边，它是用来取代10年前被飓风“雨果”摧毁的那一座。
